messages.message:
> is it time to delete a bunch of unnecessary rows from the db? did you do this in the past, or am i imagining things?
@Xindi Xu btw have you done this in the past? ^
i’m still seeing slowness causing failures for a lot of Cypress CI runs today :disappointed:
maybe the slowness is because there are 6 concurrent CI runs?

I've never removed rows from the DB. It'd be easier if we could have a DB snapshot of all the required data (pre-exiting apps, projects required to run all cypress tests) and periodically reset the DB back to the snapshot.

i’m not sure how we can get a useful db snapshot unless we manually clean up unnecessary rows in the db :thinking_face:

@mfichman do you have any suggestions for how to resolve the `slow db query` logs in `core-platform-service` to improve performance in crafting-cyp.test.instabase.com (http://crafting-cyp.test.instabase.com)? maybe there’s an easier way besides deleting a bunch of rows from the db?

i’m now seeing these errors in `core-platform-service`
```ERROR coreplatformservice/aihub/handler.go:487 -- [INTERNAL]: Could not read projects (Err: Error 1040 (08004): Too many connections)```
do we need to modify the db config or the `core-platform-service` config somehow?
i revived this old thread (https://instabase.slack.com/archives/C01N7DV1137/p1731974438225569?thread_ts=1723658240.438109&cid=C01N7DV1137) when we upgraded our RDS instances in August
has Cypress CI been working for anyone on Friday / today? if not, should we make Cypress CI non-blocking for now?

I was able to get a green Cypress run (https://github.com/instabase/instabase/pull/64983) over the weekend, but that was after 5 consecutive failures. I’m all for making Cypress non-blocking for now until we stabilize things
agreed, can you make the change since you’re on-call this week? :sweat_smile: i’ll be afk for a bit
Yup, I’ll make the change now. I actually switched with @Udit for this week because I’m out Thursday and Friday.
